chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Laterrence Devon Carr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Threat To A Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Provide DNA sample.
Court orderd the defendant to pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  If revoked court ordered that all court costs, fees and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any unpaid amount due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Full time work, minimum of 40 hours of work per week.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
No contact with M.C. unless approved by probation agent.

Mental health examination and follow through with any recommended treatment.
Complete anger management course.
Complete Batterers Intervention program.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes: With Day Reporting Center and huber release for work and treatment.  Court allows good time credit.

charges.descr: Threat To A Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laterrence Devon Carr

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Attorney Brett Copeland

Defendant Laterrence Devon Carr in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Laterrence Devon Carr in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded. 

...
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS with 123 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION IF REVOKED: 
- 9 MONTHS condition time (with Day Reporting Center and Huber release for work and treatment.  Court allows good time credit.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Provide DNA sample.
- Full-time work (minimum of 40 hours of work per week).
- Complete 75 hours of community service.  
- Mental health examination and follow through with any recommended treatment.
- Complete anger management course.
- Complete batterers intervention program.
- No contact with M.C. unless approved by probation agent. 


Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Laterrence Devon Carr not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a bail/bond hearing. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea and sentencing hearing remains scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 8:30 AM.

Attorney Fred Richardson for Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Laterrence Devon Carr not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held OFF THE RECORD.  Defense counsel requesting a Bail review and a Plea and Sentencing date.  The matter was adjourned back to Branch 40.

  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Laterrance D. Carr - #2022001820, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Laterrence Devon Carr in court by video with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland who appears in person.  Defendant Laterrence Devon Carr in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Tibbs.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Laterrence Devon Carr not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Copeland was present, but the States witness was not. States witness appeared, but Attorney Copeland had a motion hearing to attend. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Laterrence Devon Carr not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order as to citizen witness only.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Laterrence Devon Carr in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Laterrence Devon Carr in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Laterrence Devon Carr appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
